data.title: Queen "A Night At The Opera" album and song lyrics
data.meta_description: The Ultimate Queen site, featuring album details, videos and DVD's, song lyrics and versions, demos, unreleased songs, discographies, galleries and concerts
data.text:
<< A Kind Of Magic

Tweet

Flash Gordon >>

A Night At The Opera

Released 21 November 1975, reached no 1, on chart for 50 weeks, achieved Platinum status.

Album length 43:16, 2011 bonus EP length 19:00.

Produced by Queen and Roy Thomas Baker

Engineered by Mike Stone with additional engineering by Gary Lyons

Recorded at Sarm, Roundhouse, Olympic, Rockfield, Scorpio and Lansdowne Studios, August - November 1975

Mixed at Sarm Studios

Cast: Freddie Mercury: vocals, vocals, Bechstein Debauchery and more vocals

Brian May: guitars and orchestral backdrops

Roger Taylor: percussion

John Deacon: electric bass

Equipment supervision - John Harris

Art direction - David Costa

Special thanks to Rick Curtin & Brian Palmer

No synthesisers!

All titles composed, arranged and performed exclusively by Queen

2011 Reissue Notes:

This 2011 version has been meticulously re-created using the finest modern analogue and digital technology from the original first-generation master mixes.

Executive producers - Brian May and Roger Taylor

Mastered by Bob Ludwig at Gateway Mastering Studios, Portland, ME

Audio supervised by Justin Shirley-Smith and Kris Fredriksson.

Additional audio restoration by Kris Fredriksson

Special thanks to Joshua J. Macrae, Greg Brooks and Gary Taylor, Paul Alexander and all at Cedar Audio, All at Astoria studio

Sleeve notes by Greg Brooks and Gary Taylor

Bonus material mastered by Adam Ayan at Gateway Mastering Studios, Portland, Maine, audio restoration by Kris Fredriksson.

Special thanks to Greg Brooks, Gary Taylor, all at British Grove Studios and FX Copyroom, Paul Alexander, and all at Cedar Audio

This album was also released on the DVD-Audio format, and as a 30th Anniversary CD & DVD set.

See also the 2006 documentary DVD 'The Making Of 'A Night At The Opera''.

The original cassette release has a slightly different tracklisting, swapping the positions of 'Good Company' and 'Seaside Rendezvous'.

Singles:

Bohemian Rhapsody / I'm In Love With My Car (no 1, 31 October 1975) [discography]

You're My Best Friend / '39 (no 7, 18 June 1976) [discography]

Later Singles:

Bohemian Rhapsody / These Are The Days Of Our Lives (no 1, 9 December 1991) [discography]

Bohemian Rhapsody EP (various versions) (download only, 19 December 2005) [discography]

Bohemian Rhapsody (with The Muppets) (one track download, no 32, 14 December 2009) [discography]

Bohemian Rhapsody / I'm In Love With My Car (40th anniversary reissue, 27 November 2015) [discography]
